content.rendered:
Drug & Alcohol Rehab Near London

If you’re looking for a safe, effective, and compassionate  addiction treatment near London, Abbington House is just 45 minutes away by train and less than an hour by car. We offer private, residential treatment for people across Greater London, including those navigating drug or alcohol addiction for the first time and those returning for deeper support. Our peaceful setting in the Hertfordshire countryside provides a much-needed break from the noise, pressure, and pace of London life.

Call for Help

Looking for Addiction Help Near London? Discover Abbington House

At Abbington House, we understand how hard it can be to reach out for help, especially in a city like London, where life moves fast and addiction often hides in plain sight. That’s why we’ve created a space where you can truly stop, breathe, and begin again. We offer a clinically robust, trauma-informed programme grounded in compassion, honesty and personal growth. Clients from across London choose us for our calm setting, dedicated care team, and flexible admissions.
  • Just 35 mins from London by train
  • Private, peaceful accommodation
  • Medically supervised detox
  • Individual therapy, group work, and trauma recovery
  • Neurodivergent and LGBTQ+ friendly support
  • Our programme is suitable for people of faith.
Call Our Admissions Team

Why Choose Abbington House: A Residential Rehab Centre Near London

Why Choose Abbington House: A Residential Rehab Centre Near London

Unlike many London-based rehabs, Abbington House offers the space and stillness needed for real transformation, without disconnecting you from loved ones and life back home. Every aspect of our care model is tailored, person-centred, and discreet. Here are some of the key reasons to choose us for private rehab treatment:

Individualised Addiction Care

Your story is unique and your recovery should be too. Every resident receives a tailored treatment plan with one-on-one therapy, trauma work, relapse prevention and personal growth goals.

Trauma-informed, non-clinical setting

We recognise that for many with addiction, childhood trauma and mental health challenges can often be a barrier to recovery. We’ve replaced sterile, clinical settings with warmth, natural light, and comfort. Abbington House feels more like a home than a hospital, something our London clients often say helps them feel at ease sooner.

Medically Assisted Drug and Alcohol Detox

Whether you’re detoxing from alcohol or drugs including cocaine, benzodiazepines, or opiates, our team provides 24/7 supervision in a safe and calm setting, using evidence-based guidelines for withdrawal management.

Family Therapy

Rebuilding trust with loved ones is often a key part of recovery. Our therapists work with families to unpack dynamics, improve communication, and foster long-term healing. At Abbington House, we know how important the family unit is in the recovery journey.

Nutritional Chef

Our in-house chef prepares fresh, nourishing meals every day. For clients recovering from long-term alcohol or drug use, nutrition plays a huge role in mood, focus and energy.

Safe Accommodation

Every room is private, clean, and thoughtfully designed to help you feel relaxed and safe. Communal areas are welcoming and peaceful, no fluorescent lights or hospital corridors here.

Aftercare & Alumni

London-based aftercare options are available through our alumni network. Whether you live in Hackney or Harrow, you’ll have access to support that fits your local reality. Our team will begin building your aftercare plan early, ensuring you have the tools and confidence to continue your recovery journey.

Getting to Abbington House From London

By Train: Fast trains from London Euston to Tring or Berkhamsted take approximately 35 minutes. Please call us if you require travel support.

By Car: Abbington House is around a 45–60 minute drive from Central London via the M1 or A41.

This combination of proximity and privacy is what makes Abbington House the preferred residential rehab near London for individuals seeking space to recovery safely while maintaining a close distance to loved ones back in London.

Who We Help

Addiction can affect anyone from high-level professionals to students, from stay-at-home parents to creatives. At Abbington House, we support:

  • Professionals dealing with stress, burnout or alcohol dependence
  • People navigating co-occurring conditions like trauma, ADHD or anxiety
  • Repeat rehab visitors needing deeper therapeutic work
  • Neurodivergent and LGBTQ+ clients seeking sensitive care
  • People from all cultural and spiritual backgrounds

You don’t need to “look like” someone struggling with addiction to ask for help. If alcohol, drugs or compulsive behaviours are getting in the way of your life, Abbington House near London can help you take back control.

Supporting a Loved One in London With Addiction

Many of our admissions come from family members, friends or colleagues who are worried about someone they care about. We help loved ones across London with:

  • Advice on starting the conversation
  • Practical help with interventions and referrals
  • Emotional support for spouses, parents and adult children
  • Family therapy, both on-site and remote

We know how hard it is to watch someone you love struggle and we’ll help you support them (and yourself).

What Happens After Residential Rehab?

Leaving the safety of rehab can feel overwhelming, especially when returning to the demands of London life. That’s why our aftercare planning starts early and includes:

  • Weekly check-ins and remote therapy
  • Alumni events both in-person and online
  • Support with housing, work and local recovery groups in London
  • Personalised relapse prevention planning

Recovery doesn’t end at discharge, it evolves. And we’ll evolve with you.

Take the Next Step

If you’re ready to explore private rehab near London, Abbington House is here for you. We offer fast, confidential admissions with a team who truly cares. Whether you’re calling for yourself or a loved one, we’ll meet you with warmth, respect, and expert guidance, no pressure, no judgement.

Call our admissions team today to begin the conversation. You don’t have to figure this out alone.
Call 01438 583222

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best private drug and alcohol rehab near London?

The best drug and alcohol rehab near London is one that makes you feel comfortable, safe and understood. If you would like to book a tour of Abbington House, please call our team today for a visit.

Is this suitable for working professionals living in London?

Absolutely. Many of our clients are London-based professionals seeking a discreet, confidential space to recover from stress-related addiction, burnout, or alcohol dependency. Our setting offers privacy without isolation and tailored support for high-functioning individuals.

Do you treat co-occurring conditions like anxiety or ADHD?

As a trauma-informed rehab, we recognise the need to support our clients where they are. Our programme and therapy offering can be adapted for your specific needs and sensitivities. Our team are very adaptable and we are always finding new ways to support different communities.

Does Abbington House offer alcohol detox for London residents?

Yes. We provide medical alcohol detox in a fully residential setting for clients from across London. All detoxes are overseen by experienced professionals to ensure safety, comfort, and dignity throughout the process.

What addictions do you treat?

We treat a wide range of addictions including alcohol, cocaine, cannabis, heroin, ketamine, prescription drugs, and behavioural addictions such as gambling. We also offer dual diagnosis support for clients facing both addiction and mental health challenges.

Can I still access support in London after rehab?

Yes. Our aftercare programme connects clients with ongoing support across London, including our alumni group. We ensure your recovery plan fits your lifestyle and community.

How much does private rehab cost in London?

The cost depends on the length of stay. Abbington House prides itself in offering competitive private rehab pricing with flexible options. Contact our admissions team if you would like to learn more.
